etymology.description: 燕麦(燕麥) (yànmài, "oat") + 粥(粥) (zhōu, "porridge") — oat porridge
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 燕麦(燕麥) (yànmài, "oat") and 粥(粥) (zhōu, "porridge") describes a creamy dish made from oats. This reflects the common practice of preparing porridge from different grains.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢燕麦粥(我喜歡燕麥粥)，因为它很健康(因為它很健康)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān yànmàizhōu, yīnwèi tā hěn jiànkāng.
examples.english: I like oatmeal porridge because it is very healthy.

examples.chinese: 早餐我常喝燕麦粥(早餐我常喝燕麥粥)。
examples.english: I often drink oatmeal porridge for breakfast.
